title: Cross site scripting (content-sniffing)

profile.name: Khan Academy
profile.about: Start learning now. Completely free, forever.

## Impact

Malicious users may inject JavaScript, VBScript, ActiveX, HTML or Flash into a vulnerable application to fool a user in order to gather data from them. An attacker can steal the session cookie and take over the account, impersonating the user. It is also possible to modify the content of the page presented to the user.

activities.message:
@sarmadkhan were you able to craft an XSS payload with this? I can see the language input getting reused in the resulting JSON, but I don't think it gets evaled. I'll still see if we can address it since it's weird to reproduce user input like that, but a valid XSS attack would obviously be higher priority. Thanks!

Dave
activities.markdown_message:
@sarmadkhan were you able to craft an XSS payload with this? I can see the language input getting reused in the resulting JSON, but I don't think it gets evaled. I'll still see if we can address it since it's weird to reproduce user input like that, but a valid XSS attack would obviously be higher priority. Thanks!

Dave

activities.message:
Sorry for the delay! I've made an issue for this in our internal tracker so we can look into doing it; it will be prioritized according to its severity and how difficult it ends up being for us to implement.

If you send me your Khan Academy account email or username I'd be happy to give you our [Friendly Hacker](https://www.khanacademy.org/badges/friendly-hacker) badge.

best,
Dave
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hi @sarmadkhan,

I deployed a fix this morning that should prevent this. We now verify that `lang` parameter only contains characters used in actual language tags :)

Best,
Dave
activities.markdown_message:

Best,
Dave
